item.title: After Silent Hill f, Going Back to the Seriesâ€™ Roots May Be Impossible
item.description:
After Bloober Team's highly-received Silent Hill 2 Remake last year, all eyes are on Silent Hill f as the upcoming latest installment in the storied series. The original SH2 is often considered one of the best and most important games in the psychological survival horror genre, and though there were some questions initially surrounding it, the reworked version delivered an excellent experience that captured the weight of the original while adjusting for modern sensibilities. Konami then tapped developer NeoBards for a new original entry in the IP, and Silent Hill f promises to move beyond some of the franchise's established and expected foundational elements while still retaining the core ingredients that define it.

Releasing soon on September 25, Silent Hill f will mark an experimental direction and some significant departures for the series, but also aim to retain its intrinsic spirit. In many ways, it looks to iterate on the updates and improvements imparted into the SH2 Remake while telling a completely new tale in a fresh setting. This approach has many fans equal parts excited and cautious about how it will pan out. But the prospect of an original entry after a long period of dormancy is nevertheless compelling. And if Silent Hill f does succeed in moving the series forward in a bold new way, this could mean going back to its origins will be more of a challenge.

Konami and Bloober confirmed previous assumptions earlier this summer that they will be partnering again for the Silent Hill 1 remake, though no release window has been provided as yet.

After Silent Hill f, It May be More Difficult for the Franchise to Return to its Roots

Silent Hill Has Walked a Rocky Road to its Present State

The first few entries, particularly Silent Hill 1 through SH3 , which were developed mostly by the original Team Silent, are held in high regard as classics. However, after this period, the general sentiment was that Silent Hill started to go a little downhill, stumbling along the way. Of note, the titles in question during this time were largely developed by Western studios, and resulted in a string of more unevenly received and reviewed games compared to the original trio.

Game

Release Year

Developer

Silent Hill: Homecoming

2008

Double Helix Games

Silent Hill: Shattered Memories

2009

Climax Studios

Silent Hill: Downpour

2012

Vatra Games

But with NeoBards at the helm for Silent Hill f, and it drawing heavily from a Japanese-influenced setting and characters, it may pave a new path for SH that can't be walked back.

Why There Might be No Going Back for the Series After Silent Hill f

As the first major entry in the series in over 20 years, Silent Hill 2 Remake was a phenomenal success. In some ways, it seemed a safe bet for Konami to remake arguably the most popular title, but its success was far from guaranteed. Now that the franchise has been given a positive shot in the arm, though, the changes that Silent Hill f promises to make, not the least of which is being set in rural 1960s Japan, could wind up setting the stage for more similar shifts in direction in the future and continuing to distance SH from its past.

Technically, Silent Hill f isn't the first to be set in a location other than the iconic town, as for example, Homecoming takes place in protagonist Alex's home of Shepherd's Glen.

Depending on Silent Hill f 's reception, the series could then find itself at an interesting crossroads. If it also proves successful, and fans embrace its changes in direction, it could then inform how Konami handles the IP going forward. Another major consideration is Silent Hill Townfall , the next project in line after Silent Hill f , although not many details are currently known about its direction. But reading between the lines of the implications of the title itself, Konami may be planning to return more firmly to the series' roots next. And this could end up being a double-edged sword if Silent Hill f is received well, and player sentiment then calls for further games in the same style and vein compared to more traditional directions.

Silent Hill f

item.title: Games That Were The End Of An Era
item.description:
Everything that has a beginning has an ending. No matter how beloved some gaming characters and stories are, there comes a time when players must say goodbye. The retirement of a fan-favorite hero is always a risky endeavor, demanding that developers consider all fan expectations and deliver a grand finale that feels like a sincere closure.

The games below are such examples of the end of an era â€” in many cases, not only for iconic characters and their stories but also for the familiar formula, marking a change for the studio responsible for the franchise, or even grander shifts. Notably, with a few rare exceptions, almost every case below ended on a high note, providing a satisfying conclusion to years of storytelling and the evolution of a franchise.

Mass Effect 3

A Farewell to Commander Shepard & Former BioWare

Mass Effect 3
9 /10
16
9.0 /10
Released
March 6, 2012

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Partial Nudity, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

One of the last games developed by the "old" BioWare, Mass Effect 3 marked the conclusion of one of the best action-RPG trilogies, bringing Commander Shepard's fight against the Reapers to a close. With all of the player's choices from previous games carrying over to the finale with meaningful consequences, the Mass Effect trilogy stands in a league of its own.

Of course, not everything went smoothly, given the high fan expectations for the trilogy's finale. Mass Effect 3 's ending was among the most controversial not only in BioWare's history but in gaming at large, prompting the team to release the Extended Cut DLC to smooth things over. Since then, Mass Effect: Andromeda has largely ignored the Reaper and Shepard plot, and it remains unknown whether Shepard will play any role in the next Mass Effect game.

Assassin's Creed 3

An End To Desmond Miles' Modern-Day Narrative

Assassin's Creed III
8 /10
7.4 /10
Released
October 30, 2012

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Strong Language
Powered by

Assassin's Creed 3 not only wrapped up the modern plot featuring Desmond Miles but also marked a significant shift in the franchise's turbulent evolution. For a time, the games featured as little modern-day storytelling as possible before moving forward with a rather messy narrative driven by Layla Hassan, only to scrap that again with the recent Assassin's Creed Shadows , which features no modern-day subplot.

While not as impactful as some other games listed here, especially given how closely Assassin's Creed 4: Black Flag followed the gameplay formula of the third game, many fans still consider Assassin's Creed 3 a cornerstone of the series, and many miss Desmond to this day.

Gears of War 3

Epic Games Is Done With Marcus Fenix

Gears of War 3
10 /10
8.9 /10
Released
September 20, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Powered by

A soft conclusion to Gears of War , given that Marcus Fenix and other familiar characters appeared in both Gears of War 4 and Gears 5 , Gears of War 3 was marketed as a big finale to the characters' story, concluding his active role in the never-ending Locust War. It was also the last game in the series made by Epic Games.

In many ways, the game was a fitting end to the Marcus Fenix era of the Gears franchise, featuring refined gameplay, a strong emotional core, and plenty of memorable moments to satisfy longtime fans. Still, it is evident that the creators don't want to say goodbye to Marcus just yet, leaving Gears 5 on a cliffhanger and focusing on Gears of War: E-Day instead to bring the series back to its roots.

God Of War 3

The Final Chapter Of Greek-Era Kratos

God of War III
8 /10
13
9.0 /10
Released
March 16, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content
Powered by

Another soft conclusion to a major era of the franchise, God of War 3 serves as an epic finale to Kratos' Greek era, wrapping up his period of rage-fueled revenge against every Olympian. A pinnacle of the action genre of its time, God of War 3 raised the stakes and spectacle to a whole new level, with few competitors capable of matching its visuals and brutal combat.

What's even greater is that it wasn't the end of Kratos. God of War (2018) followed as one of the best reboots that players have seen so far, presenting a different yet familiar version of Kratos while respecting the character's past and legacy in just the right way.

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt

Geralt Of Rivia Has Earned His Rest

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
9 /10
55
9.5 /10
Released
May 19, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Use of Alcohol, Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content
Powered by

Some may argue that CDPR's Witcher trilogy can rival Mass Effect among action-RPG trilogies with overarching narratives, yet Geralt's closure feels even more emotional and satisfying. After all the events of three games, The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt lets Geralt finally earn his rest, leaving players on a bittersweet note without needless tragedy.

In addition, The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt marked the end of an era for CDPR as a niche European RPG developer, elevating the studio to the higher echelon of RPG makers with one of the most acclaimed games ever. It would be hard for the studio to pass up the opportunity to bring Geralt of Rivia back in some capacity in the upcoming Witcher 4 , but for now, fans can only guess.

Uncharted 4: A Thief's End

A Perfect & Heartwarming Finale For Nathan Drake

Uncharted 4: A Thief's End
10 /10
13
9.2 /10
Released
May 10, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Blood, Language, Use of Alcohol and Tobacco, Violence
Powered by

Perhaps one of the most satisfying endings for an iconic character, Uncharted 4: A Thief's End concluded the series in a wholesome way, sending Nathan Drake to his long-earned family life. An incredible achievement both technically and in storytelling, it's hard to imagine a more fitting end for Nate and Elena, with Uncharted 4 standing as one of the highest points among PlayStation titles.

On top of that, Uncharted 4: A Thief's End was the last universally beloved mainline game from Naughty Dog, given how divisive The Last of Us Part 2 proved to be. Now, after years spent on these two franchises, the studio is preparing to introduce its new IP, Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet , claimed to be its most expansive game yet.

The Walking Dead: The Final Season

A Truly Final Season In More Than One Way

The Walking Dead: The Final Season
6.7 /10
Released
August 14, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Powered by

The Walking Dead: The Final Season was not just an emotional end to Clementine's story, which spanned five seasons of episodic games, but also, unfortunately, marked the decline of the old Telltale Games. After The Final Season , things were never the same for the studio, which entered a turbulent phase â€” evident in the ever-elusive The Wolf Among Us 2 that many believe will never see the light of day.

The Walking Dead: The Final Season also signaled a notable shift away from the once-popular episodic format in gaming, which had dominated story-driven titles since the first season in 2012.

Batman: Arkham Knight

Perfecting The Superhero Action Genre

Batman: Arkham Knight
9 /10
22
8.5 /10
Released
June 23, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

Another title that marked the end of an era, not just for an iconic character but also for an acclaimed studio, Batman: Arkham Knight served as an epic finale for Bruce Wayne (voiced by Kevin Conroy) and represented a new high point for superhero games in general. From groundbreaking visuals to refined combat and open-world mechanics, Arkham Knight was a prime example of a fitting, high-profile conclusion as the studio prepared for new horizons.

However, almost no other DC follow-up has been well-received ever since. After the disappointing results of both Gotham Knights and Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League (despite featuring the return of Batman), Rocksteady is reportedly looking to recapture its former glory with a new single-player Batman game. Whether it can win back longtime fans remains to be seen.

Halo 3

Bungie & Master Chief Go Their Separate Ways

Halo 3
9 /10
12
9.2 /10
Released
September 25, 2007

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Mild Language, Violence
Powered by

A satisfying and fulfilling ending to the Master Chief's story, envisioned by the series' original creators at Bungie, Halo 3 represented one of the biggest gaming blockbusters of its time. Garnering glowing reviews and worldwide recognition, Halo 3 stood as a new high point for the FPS series, with many believing Bungie came as close to perfection as possible.

While Halo 3 wasn't the true ending for Master Chief, given that the character plays a major role in every subsequent mainline Halo game, including Halo 4 , Halo 5: Guardians , and Halo Infinite , things just weren't the same after Bungie ended its work on the franchise and 343 Industries took the reins.

Metal Gear Solid 4: Guns Of The Patriots

An Epic Conclusion To The Metal Gear Saga

Metal Gear Solid 4: Guns of the Patriots
8.5 /10
Released
June 12, 2008

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood, Crude Humor, Strong Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

A game unlike any other, wrapping up an extremely ambitious and expansive Metal Gear saga with a tangled narrative, Metal Gear Solid 4: Guns of the Patriots was a true event and an epic closure to Hideo Kojima's influential stealth-action series. Packed with set pieces and emotional twists, the game rightfully earned its place among the best releases of the PS3 era.

While Guns of the Patriots essentially wrapped the overarching narrative of the entire saga, serving as a farewell to many well-established characters, including Solid Snake himself, it wasn't the end for the series. Several years later, Kojima returned to Metal Gear one last time with Metal Gear Solid 5: The Phantom Pain , but that's another story.

item.title: Cookie Run: Kingdom Players Have Until October 21 to Claim New Code
item.description:
Cookie Run: Kingdom developer Devsisters shared a new promo code for the game: SPECIALONAIR. The limited-time coupon allows players to grab a wide variety of Cookie Run: Kingdom freebies, including over a dozen Fateful Cookie Cutters and thousands of Crystals.

In late summer 2025, Devsisters began teasing a new Cookie Run: Kingdom update that will debut Silent Salt Cookie, among other novelties. Dubbed "Catacombs of Silence," the upcoming patch is scheduled to roll out on September 24.

Ahead of this release, Devsisters has shared a new promo code that allows players to grab free Cookie Run: Kingdom Crystals and a bunch of other digital goodies. The code, SPECIALONAIR , is valid until October 21. It was shared via the South Korean developer's domestic social media channels, with the original post stating that the code is valid until 11:59pm. It remains unclear whether the cutoff refers to local time or a fixed KST deadline, which would translate to 10:59am EST. Historically, Cookie Run: Kingdom promo codes used a dynamic cutoff, with most of them expiring at 11:59pm local time.

How To Redeem New Cookie Run: Kingdom Promo Code

  1. Go to coupon.devplay.com/coupon
  2. Redeem coupon code SPECIALONAIR (one per account)

The SPECIALONAIR coupon is valid until October 21, at 11:59pm (likely local time, though the time zone has yet to be confirmed).

The promo code nets players 4,500 Cookie Run: Kingdom Rainbow Cubes for obtaining costumes, as well as 5,000 Crystals, which are the game's general-purpose premium currency. 15 Fateful Cookie Cutters are also part of the package, with these consumables being used to pull on the Gacha of Fate, a banner focused on cookies that are "bound by Fate." Unlike the time-limited banner tickets, Fateful Cookie Cutters are of the permanent variety and can be spent at any time.

The SPECIALONAIR promo code also unlocks 200 Radiant Beascuit Doughs. These are used on Beascuitsâ€”the gear introduced as part of the Cookie Run: Kingdom Beast-Yeast update in January 2024â€”to selectively reset their bonus effects, allowing players to reroll specific lines instead of doing a complete wipe. Radiant Beascuit Dough is hence much more valuable, but also rarer, than its regular counterpart. Finally, the newly shared promo code nets players three pieces of Butter Amber, a Mine/Workshop material that's essential for crafting Epic-tier Topping Tarts, gear that grants a primary stat bonus when equipped.

Cookie Run: Kingdom 'SPECIALONAIR' Promo Code Contents

  • 15 Fateful Cookie Cutters
  • 5,000 Crystals
  • 4,500 Rainbow Cubes
  • 200 Radiant Beascuit Doughs
  • 3 Butter Ambers

Cookie Run: Kingdom players currently have one other promo code available: MISSEARTHBREAD25. Redeeming it unlocks 3,000 Crystals, 1,500 pieces of Choco Chalk, and 1,500 Rainbow Cubes. This particular coupon has been available since late August 2025 and is set to expire on September 28, at 11:59pm PT.

105
9.6 /10

item.title: Early Silent Hill f Copies Are Already Out in the Wild
item.description:
Silent Hill f is just a few short days away from its official release, but some lucky players have already put their hands on physical copies of the game. Silent Hill f is the much-anticipated new chapter in the Silent Hill series, and fans are excited about the September 25 release date. However, players who are avoiding spoilers to experience the game fresh may want to tread carefully around message boards and YouTube between now and the release date.

Silent Hill f takes place in 1960s Japan, a shift from the American backdrop of the original games. Players will follow the story of Silent Hill f protagonist Shimizu Hinako, a teenager living in fictional Ebisugaoka, who sees her town fall silent into a thick fog. Puzzles and horrific monsters are waiting for Hinako at every turn as she tries to navigate the mysterious fog and its psychological effects. Silent Hill f is the first new main series entry since the 2012 release of Silent Hill Downpour .

Silent Hill f Copies Appear Before Street Date

A Resetera user named Rod posted a warning to Silent Hill f fans that physical copies of the game have been found in the wild. Players who are trying to avoid all spoilers should navigate message boards and YouTube carefully until the game is released officially on September 25. While the Deluxe Edition of Silent Hill f will release on September 23, physical copies of the base game out in the world means three extra days that fans may need to avoid game spoilers.

Some fans of the Silent Hill series are concerned about the action-based focus of Silent Hill f , so having copies in the wild may help players on the fence sway their game-buying decisions. While the game still contains the horrors and puzzles that Silent Hill fans love, some previews have suggested it has an almost Soulslike combat experience. Producers hope to attract a younger audience with the engaging action.

Konami recently announced its Tokyo Game Show lineup to include Silent Hill f , providing fans with an immersive puzzle-solving experience at the Silent Hill f: Abandoned Items Exhibition. A special stage will be held in person and online streaming on September 28, 2025, where the development team will be on hand to talk to fans. The special stage will also feature live gameplay commentary.

Silent Hill f

item.title: Sonic Racing's Feud With Mario Kart World Raises Questions for Another Nintendo Franchise
item.description:
At The Game Awards 2024, Shadow the Hedgehog -- not Sonic -- appeared on the stage's screen, hopping in his signature car before driving into what would be known as a Travel Ring to announce Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds . The ambitious kart racer shared a full reveal trailer before Nintendo formally unveiled the Switch 2's June launch date in a Nintendo Direct also announcing Mario Kart World . While the initial trailer for Mario's kart racer impressed fans, the $80 price tag did not, and Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds was quick to brag about its debatable better price and value. From here, the stage was set for Sonic and Mario's rivalry to begin anew.

This has made the press cycle for 2025 rather interesting as Sonic and Sega have only stirred the pot since. Takashi Iizuka, the head of Sonic Team, took time during a presentation at Summer Game Fest to say that unlike "another kart racing game," Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds would have cross-platform play. There's even a commercial for CrossWorlds that pulls punches straight from the '90s, blurring out Mario Kart , outright dissing Mario Kart World 's Free Roam gimmick. This leaves fans to wonder whether this attitude might cost Sonic his place in Smash .

Sonic's History in Super Smash Bros. Has Been Rocky From the Very Beginning

Sonic the Hedgehog has been a reoccurring fighter in Smash since Super Smash Bros. Brawl . He's been in four Smash titles over the years, if one counts Wii U and 3DS as separate entries. The idea of having Sonic in Smash Bros. was desired by many fans as far back as Super Smash Bros. Melee , where Sonic and Tails were rumored to be unlockable characters as part of an April Fools' Joke published by Electronic Gaming Monthly.

Yuji Naka, one of Sonic's original creators, has said that Sonic was actually considered for Melee at one point, but cut due to time constraints. Masahiro Sakurai and Shigeru Miyamoto have backed up this claim by saying Sonic would indeed have been in the GameCube installment if time constraints weren't an issue.

Sakurai has been open about the fact that Sonic was a last-minute addition to Super Smash Bros. Brawl , so getting the Blue Blur in Smash wasn't exactly easy despite Sega's open support for Nintendo at that time. After all, Sega's support for Nintendo has been clear ever since the Dreamcast failed and Sonic's games became multiplatform. Tensions have been cooling between Nintendo and Sega for a while, resulting in many Nintendo-exclusive Sonic titles in the time since. This likely plays a part as to why Sonic is actually the most reoccurring third-party character out of all of Smash Bros. so far.

The Truth Behind Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds' Recent Friendly-ish Fire

As fun as it is that Sonic's showing his famous 'tude to Mario again, it's likely only to match Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds ' theme of competition and rivalry, and it's truthfully out of respect. Sega has publicly stated that it wants to have the Sonic series surpass Mario someday, with the exact quote being "because we respect Mario, we want to catch up to and surpass him." Therefore, all this hot air is to simply goat Mario on, and from fan reaction, it seems to be working.

It's hard to see Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds ' smack talk leading to any real consequences as CrossWorlds has been planned to come to the Nintendo Switch from the very beginning. Coincidentally, Sonic -racing Switch players have had the roughest time with the game, from difficulties joining and staying in games in the open network test, trouble distributing the demo in the Americas, lack of early access, and a late after-launch Switch 2 edition. Despite these issues and all the disses to Mario Kart World , Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds will release on Switch with all the other versions just fine.

Mario and Sonic Fans Should Have Nothing to Worry About

If Sega was kicking up any real bad blood with its marketing, Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds wouldn't be on the Switch at all, which means hurting any relations with The Big N with these comments is highly unlikely. There are years of great collaborations between Sega and Nintendo that go beyond a few snide remarks, and one Mario & Sonic at the Olympic Games news cycle had commercials full of those between the mascots themselves already. A few comments for the sake of competition are likely not going to burn a bridge that's been built for years, so Mario and Sonic fans can likely look forward to settling the score themselves in the next Smash Bros. without any problems.

Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds
